matrix_password.hint: Matrix account password (required for password authentication)

matrix_access_token.hint: Matrix Access Token (required for token authentication)

matrix_auth_method.hint: Authentication method: password, token, or oauth2

matrix_auto_join_rooms.hint: Whether to automatically accept room invitations, default: True

matrix_enable_threading.hint: Whether to use message threading for replies, default: False

matrix_use_notice.hint: When enabled, the bot will send messages as m.notice instead of m.text. m.notice is typically used for bot messages and won't trigger notification sounds

matrix_enable_e2ee.hint: Whether to enable end-to-end encryption (experimental), default: False

matrix_e2ee_auto_verify.hint: Auto verification mode: auto_accept / auto_reject / manual, default: auto_accept

matrix_e2ee_trust_on_first_use.hint: Whether to automatically trust devices on first use, default: False

matrix_e2ee_key_backup.hint: Whether to enable key backup, default: False

matrix_e2ee_recovery_key.hint: E2EE recovery key (Base58 or Base64 format), leave empty to auto-generate

matrix_e2ee_proactive_key_exchange.hint: When enabled, one-time keys are replenished and room keys are distributed more aggressively (improves E2EE availability at the cost of slightly more network requests)

matrix_e2ee_key_maintenance_interval.hint: Minimum interval (seconds) for automatic one-time key replenishment, default: 60. Lower values make replenishment more aggressive

matrix_e2ee_otk_threshold_ratio.hint: Server key-count ratio (%) that triggers one-time key replenishment, default: 33. Lower values trigger replenishment earlier

matrix_e2ee_key_share_check_interval.hint: Interval (seconds) for proactive room-key distribution checks, default: 0 (disabled). When enabled, room keys are proactively shared to all member devices
